intro: Enkleia malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca enkleia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Enkleia malaccensis is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
